title: A Bayesian approach to protein model quality assessment.
abstract: Given multiple possible models  b  1 ,  b  2 , ...  b   n   for a protein structure, a common sub-task in  in-silico  Protein Structure Prediction is ranking these models according to their quality. Extant approaches use MLE estimates of parameters  r   i   to obtain point estimates of the Model Quality. We describe a Bayesian alternative to assessing the quality of these models that builds an MRF over the parameters of each model and performs approximate inference to integrate over them. Hyperparameters  w  are learnt by optimizing a list-wise loss function over training data. Our results indicate that our Bayesian approach can significantly outperform MLE estimates and that optimizing the hyper-parameters can further improve results.
